statements: SELECT * FROM customer_information;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customer_information;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_email, payment_method FROM customer_information;
SELECT * FROM customer_information WHERE payment_method = 'Credit Card';
SELECT customer_name, customer_email, payment_method FROM customer_information ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customer_information WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM customer_information WHERE payment_method = 'Credit Card';
SELECT customer_name, payment_method FROM customer_information WHERE customer_email LIKE '%gmail.com';
SELECT customer_name, payment_method, payment_details FROM customer_information WHERE customer_id BETWEEN 3 AND 5;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, payment_method FROM customer_information WHERE customer_name LIKE 'A%' ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT customer_name, phone_number FROM customers WHERE email LIKE '%gmail.com';
SELECT payment_date, amount FROM payments ORDER BY payment_date DESC;
SELECT customer_name, amount FROM customers JOIN payments ON customers.customer_id = payments.customer_id;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM payments WHERE customer_id = 2 ORDER BY payment_date DESC;
SELECT MAX(amount) AS max_amount FROM payments WHERE customer_id = 3;
SELECT customer_name, phone_number FROM customers WHERE email LIKE '%@example.com';
SELECT customer_name, email, payment_date FROM payments p JOIN customers c on p.customer_id = c.customer_id WHERE payment_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200 ORDER BY customer_name ASC, payment_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_address = '123 Main St';
SELECT payment_id, payment_amount FROM payments WHERE payment_amount > 1000 ORDER BY payment_amount DESC;
SELECT transaction_id, transaction_type, transaction_status FROM transactions WHERE transaction_status = 'Success';
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers ORDER BY customer_name ASC;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_address FROM customers WHERE customer_address LIKE '%Street%';
SELECT t.transaction_id, t.transaction_type, p.payment_date FROM transactions t JOIN payments p ON t.payment_id = p.payment_id;

SELECT c.customer_name, p.payment_amount, t.transaction_status FROM customers c JOIN payments p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id JOIN transactions t ON p.payment_id = t.payment_id ORDER BY p.payment_amount DESC, t.transaction_status ASC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT customer_id, amount FROM transactions WHERE amount > 1000;
SELECT customer_name, city, state FROM customers JOIN address ON customers.customer_id = address.customer_id;
SELECT customer_name, card_number, card_expiry FROM customers JOIN payment_details ON customers.customer_id = payment_details.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'John Smith';
SELECT customer_name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 101 ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customer_name, email, phone FROM customers WHERE customer_id BETWEEN 100 AND 200 AND phone LIKE '%123%';

SELECT c.customer_name, p.card_number, a.street_address FROM customers c JOIN payment_details p ON c.customer_id = p.customer_id JOIN address a ON c.customer_id = a.customer_id WHERE p.card_expiry >= '2023-01-01';
SELECT t.transaction_id, t.amount, t.transaction_date, c.customer_name FROM transactions t JOIN customers c ON t.customer_id = c.customer_id WHERE t.amount > 1000 ORDER BY t.transaction_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers;
SELECT address_line1, city, state, zip_code FROM addresses;
SELECT card_number, expiration_date FROM credit_cards WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT payment_method, payment_amount, payment_date FROM payments ORDER BY payment_date DESC;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM customers WHERE customer_id > 10 ORDER BY customer_name DESC;
SELECT customers.customer_name, addresses.address_line1, addresses.city FROM customers JOIN addresses ON customers.customer_id = addresses.customer_id WHERE customers.customer_id = 1;

SELECT transactions.transaction_id, transactions.amount, payments.payment_method FROM transactions INNER JOIN payments ON transactions.transaction_id = payments.transaction_id WHERE transactions.amount > 1000;
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(transaction_id) AS total_transactions FROM transactions GROUP BY customer_id HAVING total_transactions > 5;
